meanings.sent1: The king was inthroning his heir as the new ruler.
meanings.sent2: The ceremony involved inthroning the queen with great pomp and circumstance.
meanings.sent3: The cat humorously tried inthroning itself on the plush armchair.
meanings.sent4: The sun inthroning itself in the sky, casting a warm glow over the land.
meanings.sent5: The magician inthroning the volunteer from the audience in a magical chair trick.

meanings.definition: To invest with sovereign or episcopal authority.
meanings.sent1: The bishop was inthroning the new priest during the solemn ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The ceremony of inthroning the monarch was a grand affair.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel amusingly attempted inthroning itself as the ruler of the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The power of knowledge inthroning the student as the leader of the debate team.
meanings.sent5: The responsibility of inthroning the new leader fell upon the council members.
